mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, George Washington to Robert Lewis, 1796 April 17
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, George, 1732-1799
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Washington to his nephew, Robert Lewis regarding his method of collecting rents. He also mentions that he tries to avoid litigation, when speaking of a land dispute between neighbors Ariss and McCormick and himself. He ends with a note about his "Jack" or donkey, explaining it was too late to send out for breeding this season. Autograph letter signed, 2 pages, with integral address panel, "From the President U. S."
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Domestic animals
Livestock
